common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces OS after upgrading to version 11.0.4.  The issues involve connection refused errors, route not found errors, and problems accessing Pieces Core Services.  Solutions include verifying the correct port (39300), checking the .port.txt file, and ensuring all dependencies are met.

related_issues.title: Getting Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:1000
related_issues.text:
Getting Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:1000
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I tried to include the Pieces OS endpoint (127.0.0.1:1000) into my external project, but even though Pieces OS is operating, I keep getting the error "Connection refused."

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f50f1e1d-4eb2-46a2-9df7-2892ea6d319b)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* User Raju-git20 is experiencing issues connecting to PiecesOS after upgrading to version 11.0.0.
* The connection is failing even after using the new port 39300.
* Raju-git20 is working on a Python code for LinkedIn scraping and AI-powered job application.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS port has changed from its previous location.
* Raju-git20's code is trying to connect to the old port.
* The exact cause of the connection failure is unclear.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces suggested using port 39300 as the new port.
* Mark-at-pieces explained that POS has a range of ports and the exact port can be found in the `.port.txt` file.
* Mark-at-pieces offered to connect Raju-git20 with the relevant people at Pieces for further assistance.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Raju-git20 is still experiencing issues connecting to PiecesOS.
* A call has been scheduled with Mark-at-pieces to discuss the issue further.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was initially created on January 24, 2025.
* The last update was on January 28, 2025.
* The issue remains open and unresolved.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Ollama installation failure in Pieces on Ubuntu
* Problem arises due to Pieces using a snap environment with restricted access

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces attempts to use `curl` which is not guaranteed to be installed in the sandboxed environment
* Manually installing Ollama outside the sandbox has no effect

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Patch to allow Pieces to use Ollama from within the sandbox
* Infrastructure updates completed, allowing work on the patch to resume

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Patch for Ollama installation in progress, expected within the next week


**Additional Notes:**

* The latest snap version of Pieces still has the issue as of 2025-01-23
* A user inquired about alternative local LLM model download methods

**Overall**

The issue of Ollama installation in Pieces on Ubuntu has been acknowledged and work on a fix is in progress. The patch is currently being finalized and is expected to be released soon.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users report high RAM/CPU usage, particularly on Windows. Issues potentially linked to internet connection, background updates, and core services. Short-term solution: restart PiecesOS. Long-term: update to latest version, contact support for troubleshooting, consider turning off 'Live Context' feature.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation on PiecesOS Memory Usage

**Key Points Raised:**

* High memory usage of PiecesOS on user machines.
* Significant CPU usage spikes, especially on newer macOS versions.
* Concerns about PiecesOS "mining" user resources.

**Problems Identified:**

* Memory leaks leading to high RAM consumption.
* Intensive use of ML models and local processing contributing to resource usage.
* "Live Context" feature further increasing memory footprint.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Implementing "Optimize Memory" feature to unload unused ML models.
* Replacing heavy database technologies in PiecesOS 11.1.0 to improve performance.
* Planning additional fixes for future releases.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* PiecesOS 11.1.0 released with reduced memory and CPU usage.
* Continued monitoring and improvements planned.

**Note:**

* Despite initial concerns, PiecesOS is confirmed to not be mining user resources.

**Additional Information:**

* Turning off "Live Context" can reduce memory usage.
* Users experiencing high resource usage encouraged to contact Pieces for further assistance.
